REMOVE A BBQ SAUCE STAIN ON A SURFACE: First, wet Clorox® ScrubSingles™ Kitchen Pads with water and squeeze to activate cleaner. Then, Scrub surfaces to clean. Re-wet to release more cleaner. Don’t wear yourself out — you’ll probably be scrubbing the grill later. Finally, rinse or wipe up foam from surface. Hopefully the meal was as good as the cleanup! Are you looking for details on the product used in this tutorial? Click on the button below to learn more: %[Clorox® ScrubSingles™ Kitchen Pads](https://www.clorox.com/products/clorox-scrub-singles-kitchen-pads/)
REMOVE A BBQ SAUCE STAIN ON A FABRIC: First, Pre-treat with Clorox® Bleach Pen Gel for whites or Clorox 2® Pre-Treat Stain Remover Pen for colors. Then, wash in hot water with detergent and add ½ cup of Clorox® Regular-Bleach1* to whites, Clorox Smart Seek™ Bleach to whites with some color, or Clorox 2® Stain Remover & Color Booster to colors. Then, make sure the stain is completely gone before drying. If not, repeat washing instructions. When the stain is completely gone, place whites or colors in the machine dryer. Finally, kiss the cook! Are you looking for details on the products used in this tutorial? Click on the buttons below to learn more: %[Clorox 2® Stain Remover & Color Booster](https://www.clorox.com/products/clorox-2-stain-remover-and-color-booster-liquid/) %[Clorox® Regular-Bleach1](https://www.clorox.com/products/clorox-concentrated-regular-bleach/)

REMOVE AN EGG STAIN ON A SURFACE: First, Wipe away excess egg. Grab Clorox® Clean-Up® Cleaner + Bleach. To clean and disinfect: Spray 4–6 inches from surface until wet thoroughly. Let stand 30 seconds. Finally, rinse or wipe clean. Are you looking for details on the products used in this tutorial? Click on the buttons below to learn more: %[Clorox® Clean-Up® Cleaner + Bleach](https://www.clorox.com/products/clorox-clean-up-cleaner-bleach/)
REMOVE AN EGG STAIN ON A FABRIC: First, scrape or brush off excess egg particles, and rinse out the stain with cold water. Then, pre-soak garment in cold water for at least 30 minutes with a laundry detergent that contains enzymes. Wash as usual in cool water with detergent and ½ cup Clorox® Regular-Bleach1 to whites. Finally, Repeat as necessary and check for success before machine drying. Be thankful it wasn’t bacon. Are you looking for details on the products used in this tutorial? Click on the buttons below to learn more: %[Clorox® Regular-Bleach1](https://www.clorox.com/products/clorox-concentrated-regular-bleach/)
